questions.question: Which simulation result confirms the amplifier is working as intended?

answers.c: Amplified output signal with correct phase

explanations.a: No current suggests the circuit is not active.
explanations.b: Equal input and output means no amplification.
explanations.c: Correct. A working amplifier outputs a larger signal, possibly inverted depending on the type. here
explanations.d: No output signal means the circuit may be broken.

questions.question: What is a key advantage of using simulation before building a custom amplifier circuit?

explanations.a: Simulation has no impact on PCB size.
explanations.b: Testing is still required but simulation helps in early detection.
explanations.c: Correct. Simulations help find issues before hardware is built. here

questions.question: In a simulated amplifier circuit, what might a clipped output waveform suggest?

explanations.c: Correct. Clipping usually means the output voltage exceeds supply rails. here
explanations.d: Mismatch may cause distortion but not always clipping.

questions.question: Which parameter is measured in transient analysis during simulation?

explanations.a: This is measured in AC analysis.
explanations.b: Output impedance is not the focus of transient analysis.
explanations.c: Correct. Transient analysis shows how circuits respond over time. here
explanations.d: It also shows dynamic behaviors, not just steady-state.

questions.question: What role does a bypass capacitor play in amplifier circuit simulation?

explanations.a: Correct. Bypass capacitors filter power supply noise. here
explanations.c: Bypass capacitors don't change signal polarity.
explanations.d: They reduce noise, not add it.

questions.question: Which configuration gives high input impedance in amplifier design?

explanations.c: Correct. Emitter-follower (common-collector) has high input impedance. here

questions.question: Why is feedback used in amplifier circuit simulations?

answers.c: To stabilize gain and reduce noise

explanations.c: Correct. Feedback improves stability and reduces sensitivity. here

questions.question: Which parameter would most directly indicate distortion in a simulated amplifier output?

explanations.a: Correct. THD measures signal distortion in amplifiers. here
explanations.b: Bias affects operation, not distortion directly.
explanations.c: Resistance is not a distortion metric.
explanations.d: Capacitance relates to filtering and timing.

questions.question: What is typically adjusted to set the gain in a custom amplifier simulation?

explanations.b: Correct. Feedback resistors set gain in amplifiers. here

questions.question: What does bandwidth of an amplifier indicate in a simulation?

answers.c: Range of frequencies it can amplify effectively

explanations.a: Bandwidth is unrelated to power supply range.
explanations.b: Delay is related but not bandwidth directly.
explanations.c: Correct. Bandwidth defines the effective frequency range. here
explanations.d: Physical size isn't part of bandwidth.
